issue_description: Downspouts at the North-East corner and at the back of the building were noted to be discharging at the foundation.
issue_summary: Repair by extending all downspouts to discharge above grade onto the ground at least six feet from the foundation of the building.

issue_description: Localized parging deterioration was noted in areas throughout the exterior of the building including but not limited to: Front of building at garage door; South-west corner of building.
issue_summary: Repair by qualified masonry contractor recommended to prevent chance of water damage to contents, finishes and/or structure.

issue_description: Siding at the back of the building was noted to have mechanical damage.
issue_summary: Repair by qualified vinyl siding contractor recommended to remediate cosmetic defects and prevent chance of water damage to contents, finishes and/or structure.
issue_images: Damaged Siding at Back of Building

issue_name: Flashings & Trim – Deteriorated Paint, Stain and/or Caulking
issue_description: Trim around exterior components including but not limited to: the side door; two basement windows at the back of the building was noted to have deteriorated paint and caulking.
issue_summary: Refinish any wood trim with a new coat of paint or stain and replace any deteriorated or cracked caulking to prevent chance of water damage to contents, finishes and/or structure and possible material deterioration.

issue_description: The storm door at the front of the building was noted to have issues latching properly.
issue_summary: Repair by a qualified contractor recommended to improve security and reduce chance of damage to finishes and/or structure.

issue_description: Outlets and light switches were noted to be missing cover plates in: Garage; 2nd level storage room; Master bedroom walk-in closet.
issue_summary: Install cover plates on all outlets and light switches to improve safety of all occupants and prevent chance of electric shock.
issue_images: Cover Plate Missing in 2nd Floor Storage
Cover Plate Missing in Master Bedroom

issue_description: An outlet in the kitchen was noted to be loose and/or improperly secured.
issue_summary: Repair by a qualified electrical contractor is recommended to improve safety of all occupants and prevent chance of electric shock.

issue_description: No carbon monoxide (CO) detectors were noted near sleeping areas.
issue_summary: Recommend installation of carbon monoxide (CO) detectors near sleeping areas and in each room where there is a fuel burning appliance. This will improve safety of all occupants and prevent possible exposure to carbon monoxide (CO).

issue_description: GFCI protection was noted to be missing in the kitchen.
issue_summary: Recommend qualified electrical contractor install GFCI protection in above noted areas and any other potentially wet locations such as bath/washrooms, over kitchen/wet bar countertops, exterior locations less than 8' from grade level etc. This will improve the safety of all occupants and prevent chances of electric shock.

issue_description: The stairway leading to the basement was noted to be missing handrail.
issue_summary: Recommend installation of proper handrail by qualified contractor to improve safety of all occupants in prevent potential fall hazard.

issue_name: Entry Door(s) into Dwelling – Missing Self-Closing Device
issue_description: The entry door from the garage into the building was noted to be missing its self-closing device.
issue_summary: Recommend installation of self-closing device by qualified contractor to improve safety of all occupants and prevent possibility of hazardous combustion products entering home.
issue_images: Missing Self-Closing Device at Entry Door
